definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: His client was a middle-aged man who lost his wife two months ago.
sentences.chinese: 他的當事人是一位兩個月前喪偶的男性。

sentences.english: Some scruples and some reluctance the widower-father may be supposed to have felt;
sentences.chinese: 可以料想，那喪偶的父親心裏有些顧慮，有些躊躇。

sentences.english: Unmarried men are not wanted in the Sales Department , not even widowers.
sentences.chinese: 銷售部不要未婚男士，甚至連喪偶的也不要。

sentences.english: I do not think he will ever get over the loss of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 我不以爲他能克服喪偶之痛。

sentences.english: Bereaved women who exhibit their widowhood insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 對於守寡表現虛僞的喪偶婦女。

definition: to stop menstruating (as a result of pregnancy, menopause or medical condition etc)
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
